messages.content: Thanks! We're super excited!
Okay congrats and no problem!

Hey Tobias. We were able to get a great deal on a Scamp that we picked up today so we're out of the running for your adorable Burro! Good luck selling, I'd guess you'll have no issue! Thanks so much for all the info and help
Ah got it.
I believe the freshwater is 10 gallons. I currently just have the grey water running to the outside with the plan to run it to an external grey water tank if needed
Phew! What's the size of the fresh water and grey water holding tanks?
Sorry about that! Not sure how that happened
Yeah. On your fb market ad.
That is a mistake
oh wait it does?
It just says "sold" now. I thought you sold it to someone else?
Just to clarify you mean sold to you? If you are willing to pay 12k then yes but I would imagine you would want to take a look at it first at least via video?
Sold then?
K. 10:15 is probably good timing for us.
i think anytime during the day should work
What time on the 29th might work for you?
We completely appreciate that and that sounds good.

I could do a walk around video tour on Wednesday the 29th. I unfortunately dont want to show it then and I will jaut be getting off a plane and will be self isolating while I wait for a covid test result after travelling
And yes, we could probably make a weekday work. Which day are you thinking?
Could your sister take more photos of it? Or like a video tour?

Yeah if you wanted to look at it sooner we could work something out perhaps on a weekday before? I think it would be best if I was there because I did all the renovations so I would be able to answer any and all questions. I would say I would sell it outright for 12k without showing it to anyone else.
I ask this because if we were able to look at it sooner and felt like we really did want it, we may be able to offer more after all.

You mentioned in your ad that your sister was able do viewings. Let me know if there is any way we'd be able to come and do a viewing before the weekend you fly out. We could come this weekend possibly or next.

Ok. We're really thinking we'd like it. (as long as there are no surprises upon viewing). We'd be driving ~3hrs with the $ and hoping to take it back with us, but sounds like maybe that's not what would work for you? I also don't think we'd be able to get into any sort of bidding war with anyone, as 10 was a stretch for us.
I am planning on scheduling people to come see all around the same weekend.  Give people a chance to bid on it unless someone offers an attractively higher price
I remember reading you're in Maine. Ok. How are you planning on going about choosing a buyer if you have lots of interest? (setting my expectations)
Currently thinking August 8th
I am currently in Maine but I will be flying to Washington to sell the trailer beginning of August
How soon and how interested do they appear?
Yes I have a few other people planning to look at it

Have you had a lot of other interest? (trying to determine if our questions research and hemming and hawing are going to be an issue if we want to get it. Also, we'd be coming across from the Olympic Peninsula so need to figure out childcare and when we could come)
Nope no leaks

That makes sense. Would love some more if possible. Specifically toilet area, bed area and dining area converted into sleeping...
Any leaks?
I dont have anymore at the moment
It wouldnt be too hard. Just need a split for the propane hose to plus it in then turn the switch from ac to dc
Do you have any more pictures?
How big of a deal is it to switch the fridge over to propane?

No worries! Helps to know if it will be a good fit. It has a battery for some DC hookups and a charger when you have ac. But would probably need a beefier one to dry dock for any reasonable length of time.

Multi-use: my office (our home is small and with two little kiddos home all the time, it's really a challenge to have no space to work), guest sleeping, quarantine living (my husband is at high risk of severe Covid so if any of the other of us have any suspicious symptoms he has to move out until 72hrs after symptom resolution) and camping (but definitely interested in not having to be hooked up)... (sorry for the life story)

You have to cut a vent for a propane water heater and seal it to prevent monoxide poisoning. I set this up to be plugged in to AC which all the appliances can handle its under 15 amps as long as you dont run the heater and water hater at the same time. What are you planning on using it for?

I know I've got a bunch of random questions and promise I'm not a tire kicker! Very interested. Just new to this whole thing and learning as I go as well as figuring out what our exact needs are as a family.
Curious why electric instead of propane?
yup
yuo
Did you install it?

Yah its this one https://www.amazon.com/Bosch-Electric-Mini-Tank-Heater-2-5-Gallon/dp/B0148O658Y/ref=sr_1_3?crid=1XNPCK3UMRWIV&dchild=1&keywords=bosch+water+heater&qid=1595381877&sprefix=bosch+water+%2Caps%2C179&sr=8-3
It's electricity only?
electric
Is the water heater electric or propane?
I'm very interested.
stove is propane fridge can be propane but is currently hooked up to AC. Heat is a small electric heater.
Stove and fridge are propane? What about heat?
Yes it does
Does the table seating convert to another sleep space?

title: Maya Â· 1980 Burro Wide Version 17ft Long
